summary: Microsoft reported a solid financial performance for the fourth quarter of FY 2023, with total revenue reaching $56.2 billion, marking an 8% increase year-over-year, and a 10% increase in constant currency. Earnings per share rose to $2.69, reflecting a 21% increase. The Microsoft Cloud surpassed $110 billion in annual revenue, growing 27% in constant currency, with Azure accounting for over 50% of this total for the first time. Strategic initiatives focused on enhancing cloud and AI infrastructure are progressing well, with a strong emphasis on operational excellence and customer value. Market conditions remain favorable, with healthy renewal strength in commercial business and a growing demand for AI solutions. Notable updates include the introduction of new pricing for Copilot, which is expected to expand the total addressable market significantly. However, challenges such as the optimization trends in Azure and the impact of foreign currency fluctuations were acknowledged, alongside the need to navigate risks associated with forward-looking statements and market uncertainties.
key_highlights: Microsoft Cloud revenue reached $30.3 billion, growing 21% and 23% in constant currency.
Earnings per share increased by 21% to $2.69, exceeding expectations.
Azure accounted for more than 50% of Microsoft Cloud revenue for the first time.
Commercial remaining performance obligation increased 19% to $224 billion.
New pricing for Copilot is expected to significantly expand the total addressable market.
